comments.body: The Bogged drops shroom so it would be great if the Parched had Sand

Sand would be great, people were wanting a way to farm sand for some years now, and this seems like a cool idea. Bogged drops shrooms so making this a thematic (They usually drop something about where they spawn) drop could be really good too
Or the parched is in a new drop like you said and it drops a new item, cloth
I think that there should be a rare chance to drop nautilus shells if you kill with looting 3
Currently they drop their shells when slain with a 1 in 20 chance.
I think how it is now is fine, and they dont shed their shells. So just getting the shell on rare chance by killing them seems just fine.
Shears my guy
I am upvoting every post that talks about this. We need to make noise until Mojang listens, we can‚Äôt let them sweep this under the rug

I'm on Xbox and the boats are now so laggy & choppy for me that they've become unusable. Even more so on realms. I have to swim everywhere since for some reason swimming doesn't cause the same issue - nor does flying - so it's clearly an issue with the boat somehow and not the Xbox itself. It renders in fast enough for flying, but trying to use a boat causes such an awful choppy frame rate since the update that it gives me a migraine. Such a shame as boat travel was my main mode of transport in many of my worlds / realms so every location has a dock.
Please change this Mojang üôè
We need to keep upvoting this and persuading other people to do the same, bring it to the top of the list
This also affects me on the Switch 1. Boats are worthless now. Swimming is fine oddly enough. It was definitely fine before the last update. Nonsense.
It‚Äôs not even just Realms. I tried using a boat on my single player world and the same lag persists. It‚Äôs super frustrating.
Yes, the lagginess/choppiness with trying to use boats and horses has become a huge problem on our Realm

Absolutely unplayable.

Boats are unusable and it makes ocean travel require swimming instead of boating... It's awful.

It is currently February 18th 2026 at 8:04 p.m. eastern time. Currently trying to play Minecraft bedrock on Xbox One X on the current version and my boats will literally not move anywhere. I am playing in an offline completely vanilla single player world and as soon as I try to jump in a boat I cannot move in any direction. Every now and then it will twitch slightly but zero movement whatsoever.

100% agreed!!

Especially in Java, I hate saturation boost, how fast you shrug off damage and how you always feel the need to eat, or have to randomly wait to be able to eat in order to heal. 
And somehow Bedrock afterwards feels horrible when you're just helplessly burning and heal 1 heart every 5-6 business days.

IMO the perfect hunger system should look like;

Health Regen:

  • Regen every 2 seconds when near full food bar (at least 9/10 haunches). Then, every 4 seconds when above 6 haunches. It's a nice middle ground to both systems, without being as broken as Java.
  • Regen gets interrupted for 2 seconds after being hurt by fall damage or enemy attacks (anything other than Poison, Fire or Withering).

Sprint Loss:

  • After taking damage when either at 3 haunches and below OR when you have the Hunger effect, you can't sprint for the next 4 seconds. This is indicated by the food bar bouncing (like it does when you starve). Eating would immediately reallow you to sprint.
  • At 0 haunches, you starve and you can't sprint.
  • A new potion effect for both map makers, and possibly for balancing PVP and cutting chases short; Exhaustion. When this effect is applied, the player can't sprint at all. Maybe a new item, mob or weapon could apply it to players in survival?
  • Lunge would work the same.

Foods:

  • Stackable stews and soups, up to 16. They only take 16 ticks to eat (rather than 32).
  • Melons, Cookies, Pies, and Beets can be eaten in 10 ticks only.
  • Gapples take 48 ticks to eat (rather than 32).

I never really got why people think Bedrock healing is too slow, because I think its more realistic to try to avoid a fight for a while after you're seriously injured rather than just shrugging off all the damage and charging into combat again.

However, I get that hunger is an important part of Minecraft's combat system, so I'm willing to support this.

I agree. Here's my concept:

-Regen: Anything higher than 3 or 4 hunger bars is 1 point of health every 2 seconds (this apply to saturation too). That way you're not forced to eat every single second in a fight. Food should be off of your mind during one (unless golden apples and something new).

-Hunger: Goes down slower when healing and sprinting / sprint-jumping so that you dont eat as much. Not a big change, just the minimum so that its less annoying

Every food as an different eating speed (every low hunger food is half the time to eat). Examples: melons, cookies, beetroots, etc

Mushroom stew and beetroot soup stackable to 16 (like honey bottles) as well as water bottles, but not suspicious stews (because they dont mix together)

Glistening melon now eatable: normal eating speed, gives 1 heart of healing and better saturation.

Red and brown mushroom now eatable, but low chance to give hunger, or one of them gives poison because wild mushrooms, idk. Both half an hunger bar, fast eating speed

-Sprint: Im not sure what to do, but here: when you get hit, slows down slightly to act as if youre injured. Active for 4 seconds unless hit again, that way its now nauseating to get hit by multiple things at the same time

or

-My frostbite enchant concept from other post: Frostbite 1 to 2: enchant for swords, axes, tridents, maces and spears. When hit, apply frost

Frost effect: slows target on hit (same as powder snow) and 1 dmg per 2 seconds. Incompatible with fire aspect. Longer frost with level
The thing is that the ravager already attacks, and I think its attacks would outrange the spear anyways. Them having crossbows means the mounted pillager has a long and short range attack.
This doesn‚Äôt feel like it fits the drop theme, tbh, but I agree
I think skeleton horses should spawn with armor to avoid burning during day. Maybe zombi horses could also rarely spawn with armor
Maybe we should just make it so that neither of them burn. They‚Äôre too cool to not be able to ride around.
Both should be protected to be rided and not burn during the day
Make them stop burning with saddles.
This makes sense, actually. Maybe they just make it so zombie horses don't burn either? It would be annoying if zombie horses burned every time you tried to ride them any time other than nighttime
i think that because the skeleton horse has no flesh, its only fair that it doesnt burn
I lost the first zombie horse I found by it burning in the daylight. I thought that it wouldn't burn because skeleton horses don't burn. I think this suggestion is important for consistency.
Watery skeleton is basically the trident drowned

we need this for bedrock

pls pls pls

Mace isn't used as a main weapon but rather as a support or first attack, of course it's going to lose against the spear. Also the spear charge attack has a little delay before it works and it gives a lot of time to use a shield since you see the player flying to you. While in ground you can place blocks to kill him too and use a shield before it hits you. It could still need some nerfing with the elytra tho, like a damage cap or a logarithmic growth or something.

The mace is still useful, just has a different purpose and use.
You're rights

I find it satisfying to pop totems after a few hits, especially when in Crystal PvP, you are already doing so, if not more totems than the mace.

Spear 100% needs a rework, I completely agree. You can throw spears in real life too, so maybe the spear could be a budget trident without any of the enchantments the trident can have.

 

I do think the lunge enchantment is a decent idea, especially when reworked with hunger instead of durability being taken away. I feel like that enchantment opens the door to satisfying parkour tricks paired with the mace's wind burst!

This testing is very flawed, while I think their *jab* damage should be increased; their charge damage doesn't, you can 1 hit a zombie just by moving faster than just sprinting, not to mention; Sharpness V exists

I like Jab attacks being low damage as they are right now, especially considering attack reach and enchantments.

Fully agree about Lunge enchantment‚Äôs durability as a cost being way way too punishing. I honestly think it should be costing hunger instead of durability, that way it would actually impact combat without you needing to grind to repair your spears or reenchant new ones

Yes, I think Mojang has overdone the extra damage cost of the lunge enchantment. They need to bring that sucker down a notch or two. The point of Minecraft updates shouldn't be "how do I keep players in check", it should be "how can I make the game more fun for the players."

It feels like Mojang is trying to punish us for enjoying the new features. They worry too much about how "overpowered" or "broken" a new feature is. It feels like they are missing the point.
You‚Äôre meant to be ride a mount for the charge attack to be most effective.

It should use hunger.
I'm thinking every 3 uses should use 1 hunger and 1-3 durability used correlating to the level and the jab attack should also scale with relitive velocity (like the hold attack) which also means you can do less damage if they or you move away.

I'm not sure why we even called it a "spear" when what they meant was a lance. Genuinely all I wanted with this update was a throwing spear similar to the Trident, but with more land based enchants. It doesn't make the trident useless if you're spending more time in the water because you'd still have Riptide and Impaling, plus Channeling. 

 

This was just kind of a letdown. Lunge literally makes the weapon worse because the goal of the spear is to *keep things away from you*. So you lunge (and lose food, which nothing else does to you) and now you're too close to them. There's literally no point in that enchant. Honestly I just want a rework

^
The drop is themed around mounts, so the new weapon is useful when riding mounts. Lunging lets you gain speed, which helps with the charge attack.
The zombies should ride something else underground. Maybe something that clings to the ceiling and then drops the zombie on you?
Them spawning underground explains where they go during the daytime! I like to think of zombies taking refuge from the sun in the day, same can be said for the ZH

Perhaps it should check for a large open area before spawning zombie horses, because I'll admit if they spawn in tight caves that would be a bit odd, but if they are spawning in the wide open caves I think that sounds fine.

This comment is basically my full opinion on what is essentially the same thing. It is essentially the same suggestion but a slightly different way of wording it to show support to the idea

Zombie Horses, like Zombie Villagers, should be able to be cured, possibly using the same golden apple and weakness potion or something very similar (possibly a golden carrot). The Benefits of doing this would be that it no longer needs armour to survive in sunlight, and an increase in stats, much like how villager trades are cheaper. This would integrate an already existing mechanic into a new(ish) feature, which will make the game altogether better. Furthermore, this would be a way to improve existing mounts, and benefit the spear as it is an easy way to gain large amounts of speed, therefore making it a very good feature to add into Mounts of Mayhem.
If you'd actually read about the drop, you'd know that Mojang has already confirmed that more is coming. No need to be so impatient.

Mojang only announces around half the update in the live-stream. This gives them more time to perfect the other half of the update which will be announced in the following weeks, but not all at the same time.
In Minecraft.wiki the nautilus is neutral, so would it be like wolves where they can attack you if they are not tamed.
Oh, like the copper button and OTHER copper features from the Copper Age?

I really want to see more mountable mobs in the game, for example: what if when you stun the ravager with your shield, then quickly feed it raw meat, you tame it, and two people can ride on it's back. That, would get people hyped up for Mounts of Mayhem

They made drowns more dangerous, I dont see how that doesnt do the same thing as adding another hostile ocean mob, which is making water more dangerous. Try to appreciate what we are getting: a way to get zombie horses in survival, a new underwater mount, and a NEW WEAPON which adds a new way to move in the game. I'm confused why you arent at all satisfied with that.
Please some dev read this!!!!

I posted this:

"Why pufferfish for breeding? "Nautiluses are scavengers and opportunistic predators. They eat lobster molts, hermit crabs, and carrion of any kind." (wikipedia)

So zombieflesh could be used to tame them but there would be a chance to turn it into a zombienautilus. Please add crabs and/or lobsters for the player to hunt and use to tame the nautilus! The crabs could be added to the beaches together with palmtrees and lobsters to the ocean to make it more lively."

 

Your suggestion does not make sense because there is no direct evidence that nautiluses consume jellyfish as a regular part of their diet. The argonaut or paper nautilus does that at times but that is a different creature. We also have lanterns (with one more variant coming tuseday the 30. september) that can be placed underwater and sea pickles as well. Doubling all redstone components by having a waterproof version of them does not seem practicable and would just bloat the game.
Wow, this a very well thought out idea and I would love to see this implemented! Amazing job!
I think they should be separate weapons, each are supposed to serve a unique purpose

yes plz spears are just as much of a ranged weapon as a melee weapon in history it would be so stupid to not have the spear be throwable plz for the love of not being brain dead make spears throwable.

It makes sense. Spears should be able to be enchanted with loyalty too, but keep Channeling and Riptide trident exclusive, and don't put the trident's water range on the spear. That way, the Trident stays more of a tool and niche sidegrade for underwater combat, since that's what it's mainly used for right now anyway.

This would just make the Trident even more useless than it already is, considering how hard it is to obtain on Java. With the Combat Test Snapshots (aka Combat update); which were the only saving graces of the Trident being most likely dead, making the Spear throwable would just kill the Trident even more.

If loyalty is not allowed than the spear could drop when the mob is killed. But will recieve a larger amount of durability damage.

The spear could make a bigger impact depending on how fast it is thrown, prehaps a new enchantment that makes the spear quicker.

To throw it the user should charge it while facing upward slightly.
Spears should be able to be fired by dispensers and crossbows, dealing more damage the faster the spear projectile is.
Agree,But spears cannot be enchanted with Loyalty (only tridents can).
Romans legions throw they spears at enemy and then use they mele weapon
dont kill it for them tho

That is a great idea. We can already get tons of them from drowned and prehaps the zombie nautilus coming. Maybe they could have one material item be applied to make the Armored Shells. Maybe armor trims (if the armor will be trimmable) can even be applied.
Boats and horses are unusable right now and I have a great connection.

I have also made a post on this, and am upvoting every post that says this. We need to make noise on this even though Mojang might shut down the posts. We can‚Äôt just accept that this is ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù
I really hope this gets fixed. I wanna be able to ride my horse again
We need to continue upvoting every post like this until they make it to the top of the feedback list

Bizarre that I guess the spear is supposed to be special when riding a horse?  

I haven't figured out what's noteworthy about the spear, because riding a horse is impossible.
This is a genius idea, Mojang should definitely do it.
Although I do want this added, I really wouldn't want someone to zoom by with their elytra and snipe me and my happy ghast out of the sky (In a theoretical situation, at least).
Es buena la idea
Strays???
Oooh, then add biome variants like brown and black bears in temperate biomes!

Monuments were fine when they came out but now I agree they are a bit lack luster in loot. Ancient cities, fortresses, and mansions are easier (to me) and have better loot, end cities and bastions are about the same difficulty (again to me) and have much better loot.

Tridents, conduits, or something new in the monument (guarded by an elder or in the treasure room) would be good. Waterlogged chest dotted around containing loot would be good. Each structure seems to have a theme in the loot, monuments could be gold, some diamonds, prismarine bits, oceanic loot (nautilus shells, heart of the sea, coral, etc.) and water related enchantments would fit. (on the other hand, no books would fit because books and water don't mix.)

no i want the rockhopper. we need life on stony shores!

otherwise yes.
Amazing!
Maybe we just should be able to place the shell, this would make more sense than a block

Like when you blocked with the sword back then or like you now block with the shield, no animations. I think that's better, the spear just doesn't fit with the rest. Also, it's the only weapon that has a grip-like thing in it's texture, which is kinda weird.
